  "article_text": [
    "in this supplementary material we provide the details of the model realization , and the proof of the generic theorem to determine the topology , i.e. the chern number of a chiral superfluid / superconductor .",
    "generate a blue - detuned square lattice .",
    "the incident polarization of @xmath134 is @xmath135 , and the @xmath4-wave plate changes the polarization of the reflected field to @xmath136 .",
    "( b , c ) as illustrated for @xmath137 fermions , the lattice potential for the state @xmath138 is generated by @xmath139 .",
    "( d ) the raman coupling is generated by @xmath134 and @xmath140 , which has a tilt angle @xmath8 with respect to @xmath9-axis in the @xmath9-@xmath141 plane . ]",
    "the spin-1/2 pseudospin is defined by the two atomic states @xmath142 and @xmath143 of the atom @xmath137 .",

    "( the coefficients in @xmath177 can be calculated with the help of table  [ dipolet ] in a straightforward way . )",
    "notice that the coupling between spin - up @xmath178 and spin - down @xmath179 state through these processes are negligible since @xmath180 , where @xmath181 is the energy of the spin - up or spin - down state .",
    "the raman lattice is generated via only one raman process ( described in the diagram fig .",
    "[ realization](d ) ) .",
    "the raman potential generated is given by the formula @xmath182 .",
    "in this case , the generated potential is @xmath183 where @xmath184 .",
    "the zeeman term @xmath185 is generated by the a small off - resonant in the raman process , where @xmath186 .",
    "we derive the tight - binding model by considering the hopping contributed from lattice and raman potentials , respectively .",
    "the lattice potential contributes the spin - conserved hopping terms as @xmath187 where @xmath188 , @xmath189 and @xmath190 , and @xmath191 is the wavefunction at centered at @xmath192 . on the other hand , for the spin - flip term induced by raman coupling , we have that the first term of   provides spin - flip hopping along the @xmath10-direction of strength @xmath193 where @xmath194 .",
    "the same term gives no contribution to the hopping along @xmath9-direction since @xmath195 is antisymmetric in the @xmath9-direction at the local minimum of lattice potential .",
    "likewise , the second term of  ( [ ramanf ] ) gives rise to an onsite zeeman term @xmath196 where @xmath197 .",
    "this term gives negligible contribution to the hopping term since @xmath198 .",
    "therefore , in the tight - binding model , the raman potential contributes @xmath199+h.c.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    the total tight - binding hamiltonian reads @xmath200 , which can be simplified by applying the gauge transformation @xmath201 with the fourier transformation @xmath202 , we can finally get the bloch hamiltonian of the tight - binding model @xmath203 where @xmath204 and @xmath205 .",
    "all the parameters are independently tunable except that @xmath206 and @xmath207 are related by @xmath208 .",
    "it can be seen that the inversion symmetry is controlled by the tilt angle @xmath8 , and the gap opening at dirac points is controlled by the @xmath35 , the @xmath38-component of the @xmath2 field .",
    "note that @xmath24 is induced by onsite spin - flip transition .",

    ", we shall consider a small @xmath35-term compared with @xmath34-term .",
    "thus the @xmath2 field is mainly polarized in the @xmath36 direction .",
    "an attractive hubbard interaction can be described effectively as @xmath209 .",

    "if there are more than one of them is non - zero , we need to fold the brillouin zone .",

    "can be solved self - consistently .",
    "the bkt temperature can be calculated through the approximate bkt criterion @xmath230 where @xmath231 is the superfluid density , which is can be calculated by @xmath232 .",
    "@xmath233 is the supercurrent density and @xmath234 is the center - of - mass momentum of two paired fermions when the system cut only one fs , which is of center - of - mass momentum @xmath234 .",
    "@xmath233 is to be calculated by the variation of the zero - temperature energy , i.e. @xmath235 . the total energy @xmath236 can be calculated through diagonalization of the total hamiltonian in the nambu basis , by assuming the center - of - mass momentum of the pairing to be @xmath237 .",
    "the numerical result is shown in fig .",
    "[ fig : tbkt ]    . ]",
    "after presenting the generic result , we shall show step by step the generic theory that the topology of 2d chiral superfluid / superconductor can be precisely determined by knowing only the properties of the fermi surfaces and the topology of other normal bands away from the fermi surfaces .      for simplicity , we do not consider the case that the normal bands barely touch the fermi energy .",
    "we classify the normal bands into three groups : upper ( lower ) bands , which are those with energy above ( below ) fermi energy , and middle bands which are crossed by fermi energy .",
    "let @xmath238 ( @xmath78 ) be the total chern number of the upper ( lower ) band and @xmath81 be the chern number of @xmath77-th middle band .",
    "each middle band may form multiples fermi surfaces .",
    "we denote the pairing of the @xmath239-th fermi surface , projected on @xmath77-th band , to be @xmath240 and its phase @xmath241 .",
    "we denote @xmath242 to be the area enclosed by the fermi surface @xmath243 and @xmath244 to be the unenclosed area .",
    "notice that among each of the regions @xmath242 or @xmath244 , the energy of the @xmath77-th band is of the same sign .",
    "we shall show that in general , the formula for the chern number of the negative energy states , after considering the superconducting pairing , can be written as @xmath245 where the integral in the bracket is the winding number of @xmath246 .",
    "the integral is evaluated in the direction satisfying right hand rule .",
    "the phase factor @xmath247 and @xmath248 is @xmath88 if the energy of the @xmath77-th band is negative in the region @xmath242 and @xmath244 respectively , and they are @xmath249 if the corresponding energy is positive .",
    "we have chosen a gauge here such that the phase of the berry connection of the @xmath77-th band is continuous throughout the regions @xmath242 . the case with an alternative gauge can be found below .",
    "this quantity is non - zero if the system is topological .",
    "first , we consider the case where there is only one band in the system and there is only one fs . so the berry curvature , and thus the chern number , of the normal states is zero since we can choose a gauge of real eigenvectors where the berry connection is identically zero .",
    "+ we can calculate the berry connection , after considering the superconducting pairing , by direct calculation over each region @xmath250 . the density of the bdg hamiltonian and the berry connection can be written as @xmath251 where the @xmath252 sign denotes upper ( lower ) band .",
    "@xmath34 and @xmath35 can be found by diagonalizing the @xmath253 : @xmath254",
    "so the berry connection of the lower band is : @xmath255 since the chern number remains unchanged under all continuous changes , we can assume that @xmath256 and let @xmath257 .",
    "we can also continuously deform the system so that the fs is symmetric . in this case",
    ", the berry curvature is @xmath258 where @xmath259 denotes a function which valued to 1 inside ( outside ) the region @xmath250 and 0 outside ( inside ) , and the upper ( lower ) sign means that the region @xmath250 is of positive ( negative ) energy .",
    "the chern number can be calculated through an integral of @xmath260 @xmath261 where @xmath262 and that the berry curvature localizes on the boundaries of @xmath250 .      to generalize the equation  ( [ sichern1 ] )",
    ", we notice that when @xmath257 , the momentum modulation is unimportant .",
    "thus the chern number of the lower band depends only on the pairing within each fs . therefore , the total chern number is the summation of @xmath263 , where @xmath264 is the winding number of @xmath265 , and @xmath266 is the pairing order of the @xmath76-th fs ; when the energy of the normal states is positive ( negative ) within the region @xmath267 , we take the negative ( positive ) sign in @xmath263 .",
    "it is worthwhile to note that in general there maybe order parameters connecting two different fs ( like the bcs order @xmath211 in the main text ) . to simplify our discussion",
    ", we assume that the system contains minimal order parameters to be fully gapped . without lost of generality , we can assume that the fs looks like fig .",
    "[ gents](b ) .",
    "( if we have @xmath268 inside @xmath250 , we can just flip the sign as indicated by  ( [ sichern1 ] ) . )",
    "folding up the brillouin zone , we will find that two fs coincides with each other and that @xmath269 is the subspace of the bdg hamiltonian in the folded brillouin zone , where @xmath270 is the two center - of - mass momentum of the fs and @xmath271 is defined from @xmath272 to @xmath273 , where @xmath221 is an integer number .",
    "the minimal order parameters to fully gap the system can be @xmath274 , which we have discussed , or only @xmath211 alone .",
    "when only @xmath211 is non - zero , the winding numbers are calculated for @xmath211 around @xmath74 and @xmath234 ( as indicated by the diagonal term in the @xmath170 matrix ) .",
    "if there are many bands in the system , we call the chern number of the upper ( lower ) band be @xmath275 . these bands",
    "contributes @xmath276 to the total chern number for negative energy states in the duplicated space .",
    "the arguments in the one band system need generalization since the berry curvature of the normal bands are non - zero and an intuitive generalization of @xmath277 to @xmath278 , where @xmath279 is the eigenvector of the single particle hamiltonian , is now gauge dependent .",
    "the single particle hamiltonian density @xmath280 have eigenvectors @xmath281 so that @xmath282 and the bdg hamiltonian density can be written as @xmath283 write the bdg hamiltonian density in the bases @xmath284 and @xmath285 , @xmath286 has diagonal entries with values @xmath287 and @xmath288 and the off - diagonal entries due to @xmath289 , i.e. @xmath290 .",
    "let @xmath256 and @xmath257 , the upper and lower bands are diagonalized automatically .",
    "the hamiltonian in the subspace of middle bands can also be diagonalized as follows @xmath291 where @xmath292 .",
    "+ therefore , when the @xmath77-th middle band is duplicated and gapped by @xmath289 , the berry connection of the upper and lower band are @xmath293    there are three contributions when we calculate the berry curvature , which is the curl of this quantity : ( i ) the curvature from the normal band ; ( ii ) the extra curvature due to the mixing of two bands ( from the derivative of @xmath294 ) ; ( iii ) the curvature due to superconducting pairing .",
    "after continuously deforming the fs so that it is symmetric , we can write the berry curvature of the lower band to be @xmath295 where the upper ( lower ) sign is taken when the @xmath77-th band has positive ( negative ) energy in the region @xmath250 , @xmath296 denotes a function which valued to 1 inside ( outside ) @xmath250 and 0 outside ( inside ) @xmath297 and @xmath298 ( @xmath299 ) denotes the berry connection ( curvature ) of the corresponding normal band .",
    "+ the integral of berry curvature can be simplified to ( writing @xmath300 ) : @xmath301    notice that the third and fourth terms are gauge dependent , and they all add up to a gauge independent value .",
    "we now specify the gauge to finish the calculation .",
    "we require that : @xmath302 we call this gauge @xmath250 and for the corresponding eigenfunctions we call them @xmath303}^{(i_m)}$ ] .",
    "then the phase of @xmath277 can be defined unambiguously .",
    "( i.e. we define the matrix element in @xmath250 gauge : @xmath304}^{(i , j ) } = \\left < u_{k[\\vec{\\mathcal{s}}]}^{(i)}\\right| \\delta(k ) \\left| u_{-k[\\vec{\\mathcal{s}}]}^{(j)*}\\right>$ ] ) .",
    "the gauge merely means that the eigenvectors @xmath305 are continuous within the region @xmath250 .",
    "if we have other choice of gauge , we count the number of singularity ( with the sign determined by right hand rule ) within @xmath250 .",
    "each singularity contributes to @xmath306 extra winding of @xmath307 and is canceled by the subtraction of integral of berry connection from @xmath308 .",
    "therefore , we know that the winding in different gauge can be related as @xmath309}^{(i_m ) } \\cdot dk= \\int_{\\partial \\vec{\\mathcal{s } } } \\nabla_k \\theta_{k [ \\mathcal{g}]}^{(i_m ) } \\cdot dk + 2n_{s,\\vec{\\mathcal{s}}[\\mathcal{g}]},\\ ] ] where @xmath310}$ ] is the number of singularity inside @xmath250 in gauge @xmath311",
    ".    therefore total chern number of the negative energy states is @xmath312}^{(i_m ) } \\cdot dk \\right ) = n_l - n_u \\pm \\left ( n_f^{(i_m ) } - \\int_{\\partial \\vec{\\mathcal{s } } } \\nabla_k \\theta_{k[\\mathcal{g}]}^{(i_m ) } \\cdot dk - 2n_{s,\\vec{\\mathcal{s}}[\\mathcal{g } ] } \\right ) \\label{mochern},\\ ] ] for a general gauge @xmath311 .",
    "note that each particular middle band @xmath77 can contribute to the chern number by @xmath313}^{(i_m , j ) } + 2n_{s,\\vec{\\mathcal{s}}_{i_m , j}[\\mathcal{g } ] } \\right),\\ ] ] where the phase factor @xmath247 and @xmath248 is @xmath88 if the energy of the band is negative in the region @xmath242 and @xmath244 respectively , and they are @xmath249 if the corresponding energy is positive .",
    "it is worth noting that as in this case , one more complexity arises . as in  ( [ fbzchern ] ) , we consider order parameter that connect two fs : @xmath315 if @xmath316 and @xmath317 are of the same sign in the coinciding region in the folded brillouin zone , the argument in [ sec : omfs ] have no difficulties except the similar generalization to the solution of the problem of allotment of chern number and the problem of gauge .",
    "if @xmath316 and @xmath317 are of opposite sign , the minimal order parameter set can not be @xmath211 alone ( see fig .",
    "[ gents](c ) for illustration ) .",
    "this is just the case for the model discussed in the main text , where @xmath211 alone can not gap the system .",
    "we state without proof here that , if only @xmath211 and one of the @xmath274 is non - zero , the system can still be fully gap . without lost of generality ,",
    "suppose @xmath318 is non - zero , the @xmath319 band connect with its hole partner directly and @xmath320 band connect through two intermediate steps . the chern number of this kind of interaction can also be calculated .",
    "the direct pairing is straightforward , while for the indirect pairing ( the one containing two intermediate steps ) , we can count the winding number of the effective @xmath170 . in this case , the effective pairing between @xmath321 and @xmath316 are proportional to the multiplication of @xmath322 , @xmath323 and @xmath324 , therefore the winding of the effective @xmath170 is the sum of the winding of these three quantities . the problem concerning gauge and the allotment of the original chern number",
    "can also be similarly investigated ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> the recent realization of two - dimensional ( 2d ) synthetic spin - orbit ( so ) coupling opens a broad avenue to study novel topological states for ultracold atoms . here , we propose a new scheme to realize exotic chiral fulde - ferrell superfluid for ultracold fermions , with a generic theory being shown that the topology of superfluid pairing phases can be determined from the normal states . </S>",
    "<S> the main findings are two fold . </S>",
    "<S> first , a semimetal is driven by a new type of 2d so coupling whose realization is even simpler than the recent experiment , and can be tuned into massive dirac fermion phases with or without inversion symmetry . without inversion symmetry </S>",
    "<S> the superfluid phase with nonzero pairing momentum is favored under an attractive interaction . </S>",
    "<S> furthermore , we show a fundamental theorem that the topology of a 2d chiral superfluid can be uniquely determined from the unpaired normal states , with which the topological chiral fulde - ferrell superfluid with a broad topological region is predicted for the present system . this generic theorem is also useful for condensed matter physics and material science in search for new topological superconductors .    _ </S>",
    "<S> introduction._the recent experimental realization of two - dimensional ( 2d ) spin - orbit ( so ) coupling for ultracold atoms  @xcite , which corresponds to synthetic non - abelian gauge potentials  @xcite , advances an essential step to explore novel topological quantum phases beyond natural conditions . </S>",
    "<S> ultracold fermions with so coupling can favor the realization of topological superfluids ( tsfs ) ( similar as topological superconductors in solids  @xcite ) based on an @xmath0-wave feshbach resonance  @xcite , which are highly - sought - after quantum phases for their ability to host non - abelian majorana zero modes and implement topological quantum computation  @xcite . note that a superfluid phase has to exist in 2d or 3d regime , so having a 2d or 3d so coupling is the basic requirement for such realization of gapped tsfs . while experimental studies of tsfs are yet to be available , different proposals have been introduced for rashba and dirac type so coupled systems  @xcite , with bcs or fflo pairing orders  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> when the fermi energy crosses only a single ( or odd number of ) fermi surface ( fs ) , the so coupling forces cooper pairs into effective @xmath1-wave type , rendering a tsf phase  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> however , in the generic case it is not known so far whether there is a universal way to precisely determine the topology , e.g. chern numbers , of a superfluid phase induced in normal bands . on the other hand , to achieve a tsf phase integrates several essential ingredients , which may bring challenges for the experiment . </S>",
    "<S> the minimal schemes of realization are therefore desired to ensure high feasibility of real studies .    </S>",
    "<S> in this letter we propose an experimental scheme to realize chiral fulde - ferrell ( ff ) superfluids , and show a generic theory to compute the chern number of tsf phases through the normal states . </S>",
    "<S> the findings are of significance in both experiment and fundamental theory . </S>",
    "<S> first , we propose that a new type of 2d so coupled dirac semimetal can be realized based on a scheme adopting only a single raman transition and simpler than the recent experiments  @xcite . by readily breaking the inversion symmetry of the dirac system , we find that the ff superfluid phase can be favored under an attractive interaction . </S>",
    "<S> moreover , we show a generic formalism for the chern number of a 2d superfluid induced in the normal states , with which the topological chiral ff superfluid with a broad topological region is predicted .     generate a blue - detuned square lattice . </S>",
    "<S> the incident polarization of @xmath2 is @xmath3 , and the @xmath4-wave plate changes the polarization of the reflected field to @xmath5 . </S>",
    "<S> the raman coupling , illustrated in ( c ) for @xmath6k fermions , is generated by @xmath2 and an additional running light @xmath7 which has tile angle @xmath8 with respect to @xmath9-@xmath10 plane . ]    _ 2d dirac semimetal._we start with the effective tight - binding hamiltonian @xmath11 on a square lattice , whose realization shall be presented below : @xmath12 where @xmath13 ( @xmath14 ) is annihilation ( creation ) operator with spin @xmath15 , @xmath16 is the hoping constant along @xmath17 direction , @xmath18 is the strength of spin - flip hopping , and @xmath19 denote the effective zeeman couplings . as described in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : realization](a ) , the above hamiltonian describes a dirac semimetal if @xmath20 and @xmath21 , with two dirac points at @xmath22,0\\right)$ ] . </S>",
    "<S> the term @xmath23 breaks the inversion symmetry and leads to an energy difference between the two dirac points . </S>",
    "<S> finally , a nonzero @xmath24 opens a local gap at the two dirac points . without loss of generality </S>",
    "<S> , we take that @xmath25 and @xmath26 to facilitate the further discussion . </S>",
    "<S> as we show below , the above hamiltonian can be readily realized in experiment .    </S>",
    "<S> the realization is sketched in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : realization](b , c ) . </S>",
    "<S> the ingredients of realization include a blue - detuned spin - independent square lattice and a raman lattice generated via only a single raman transition ( details can be found in the supplementary material  @xcite ) . in particular , </S>",
    "<S> the two standing - wave lights ( red and black lines in fig .  [ fig : realization](b ) ) of frequency @xmath27 form the electric field components @xmath28 and @xmath29 , and generate the square lattice potentials @xmath30 and @xmath31 , respectively , with @xmath32 and @xmath33 . for our purpose we take that @xmath34 is large compared with @xmath35 , namely , the field @xmath2 is mainly polarized in the @xmath36 direction . the @xmath37-phase difference between @xmath36 and @xmath38 polarized components is easily achieved by putting a @xmath4-wave plate before mirror @xmath39 , as shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : realization](b ) . </S>",
    "<S> all the initial phases of the lights are irrelevant and have been neglected . to generate the raman lattice another running light of frequency @xmath40 is applied along a tilted direction so that its wave vector @xmath41 ( blue line in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : realization ] ( b ) ) . </S>",
    "<S> @xmath42 together with the light @xmath2 induces the raman transition between spin - up @xmath43 and spin - down @xmath44 , as illustrated in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : realization](c ) . </S>",
    "<S> the generated raman potential takes the form @xmath45@xmath46@xmath47@xmath46 , with @xmath48 and @xmath49 . </S>",
    "<S> the former @xmath34-term in @xmath50 leads to a spin - flip hopping along @xmath10 direction @xmath51 , and the latter @xmath35-term gives an onsite zeeman term @xmath52 , with @xmath53  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> note that a small @xmath35-term can induce a relatively large @xmath24 compared with hopping couplings , since @xmath24 is induced by on - site coupling . through a gauge transformation @xmath54  </S>",
    "<S> @xcite , we finally get the effective hamiltonian  , with the parameters being @xmath55 $ ] and @xmath56 $ ] . </S>",
    "<S> it can be seen that the inversion symmetry is controlled by the tilt angle @xmath8 , and the gap opening at dirac points is controlled by the @xmath35 , the @xmath38-component of the @xmath2 field .    </S>",
    "<S> the above realization is clearly simpler than the recent experiments on 2d so coupling , for it involves only one raman transition . </S>",
    "<S> we note that a 2d dirac semimetal driven by so interaction , being different from graphene whose dirac points are protected by symmetry only when there is no so coupling , has not been discovered in solid state materials  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> the high feasibility and controllability ensure that the 2d dirac semimetal proposed here can be well observed based on the current experiment .     versus chemical potential for the band structures ( c ) and ( d ) at @xmath57 . in ( b ) </S>",
    "<S> an insulating regime can be reached . </S>",
    "<S> the parameters are rescaled by taking @xmath58 , and we take @xmath59 and @xmath60 , where @xmath61 for ( a ) and ( c ) , and @xmath62 for ( b ) and ( d ) . ]    </S>",
    "<S> _ anomalous hall effect._when both the inversion and time - reversal symmetries are broken , the hamiltonian   leads to anomalous hall effect , which reflects the nontriviality of 2d so interaction  @xcite . fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : ahe ] shows the hall conductance @xmath63 versus chemical potential @xmath64 and the spectra in different regimes . </S>",
    "<S> the hall conductance at zero temperature is calculated by ( @xmath65 is the step function ) @xmath66 . </S>",
    "<S> \\label{hallcon}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] it can be seen that @xmath63 is always zero at @xmath67 or when @xmath64 is in the band gap [ fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : ahe](b , d ) ] . however , the nonzero @xmath63 for finite @xmath64 crossing bulk bands shows the nontrivial 2d so effect , implying that the superfluid phase of nontrivial topology may be obtained .    </S>",
    "<S> _ states of superfluidity._ the superfluid phase can be induced by considering an attractive hubbard interaction . the total hamiltonian @xmath68 . </S>",
    "<S> due to the existence of multiple fss corresponding to different dirac cones , in general we can have intra - cone pairing ( fflo ) and inter - cone ( bcs ) pairing orders , defined by @xmath69 , with @xmath70 or @xmath71  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> on the other hand , since the inversion symmetry is broken , the bcs pairing would be typically suppressed . </S>",
    "<S> the topology of the superfluid phase can be characterized by the chern number .    however , to compute the chern number of the present system is highly nontrivial . </S>",
    "<S> the reason is because the fflo order breaks translational symmetry can fold up the original brillouin zone into many sub - brillouin zones . in particular , if @xmath72 , with @xmath1 and @xmath73 being mutual prime integers , the system includes @xmath73 sub - brillouin zones . </S>",
    "<S> moreover , if @xmath74 is incommensurate with original lattice , the system folds up into infinite number of sub - brillouiin zones . </S>",
    "<S> in such generic way , it is not realistic to compute numerically the chern number of the system .    </S>",
    "<S> _ generic theory for chern number._to resolve the difficulty , we show a generic theorem to determine the chern number of a 2d system after opening a gap through having superfluid / superconductivity . for convenience </S>",
    "<S> we classify the normal bands of the system without pairing into three groups : upper ( lower ) bands which are above ( below ) the fermi energy , and the middle bands which are crossed by fermi energy . </S>",
    "<S> each middle band may have multiple fss ( loops ) , and we denote by @xmath75 the @xmath76-th fs loop of the @xmath77-th middle band . </S>",
    "<S> let the total chern number of the upper ( lower ) bands be @xmath78 ( @xmath79 ) . </S>",
    "<S> we can show that the chern number the superfluid pairing phase induced in the system is given by @xmath80 . </S>",
    "<S> \\label{eqn : generalgent}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] here @xmath81 is the chern number of the @xmath77-th middle band and @xmath82 $ ] is the phase of the pairing order projected onto the @xmath75-th fs loop  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> the integral direction is specified by arrows along fs lines in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : gent ] ( a , b ) , which defines the boundary @xmath83 of the vector area @xmath84 in @xmath85 space . </S>",
    "<S> the quantities @xmath86 are then determined by  right - hand rule \" specified below . the quantity @xmath87 ( or @xmath88 ) if the energy of normal states within the area @xmath89 is positive ( or negative ) , while @xmath90 ( or @xmath71 ) if the regions ( @xmath91 ) unenclosed by any fs loop have positive ( or negative ) energy ( fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : gent ] ) . with this theorem the chern number of the superfluid phase can be simply determined once we know the properties of lower and upper bands , and the normal states at the fermi energy , which govern the phase of @xmath92 .     in the @xmath85 space . </S>",
    "<S> the blue and green colors represent the closed fss , and the red color represents open fss . ]    to facilitate the presentation , here we show the above theorem for a multiband system , but with only a single fs . </S>",
    "<S> the generic proof can be found in the supplementary material  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> we write down the bdg hamiltonian by @xmath93 where @xmath94 is the normal hamiltonian , @xmath95 is the pairing order matrix , and @xmath85 is the local momentum measured from fs center . </S>",
    "<S> note that if fs is not symmetric with respect to its center , one can continuously deform it to be symmetric without closing the gap . </S>",
    "<S> finally we can always write down @xmath96 in the above form to study the topology . </S>",
    "<S> denote by @xmath97 the eigenvector of the normal band crossing fermi energy . </S>",
    "<S> focusing on the pairing on fs , the eiegenstates of @xmath96 has the form @xmath98^t$ ] . </S>",
    "<S> the chern number of the superfluid phase : @xmath99 , with @xmath100^\\dag\\nabla_{\\bold k}\\bigr[\\alpha^{(i_m)}({\\bold k } ) u_{\\bold k}^{(i_m)}\\bigr]+\\nonumber\\\\ & & i[\\beta^{(i_m)}({\\bold k } ) u_{-{\\bold k}}^{(i_m)*}]^\\dag\\nabla_{\\bold k}\\bigr[\\beta^{(i_m)}({\\bold k } ) u_{-{\\bold k}}^{(i_m)*}\\bigr].\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] let @xmath101 $ ] be the phase of order parameter on fs . taking that @xmath102 with @xmath103 ( without closing bulk gap ) , and with some algebra we can reach @xmath104 \\label{eqn : gaugegent}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] with @xmath105^\\dag\\nabla_{\\bold k}u_{\\bold k}^{(i_m)}$ ] being the berry connection for the normal band states . if we choose a gauge so that @xmath106 is smooth on @xmath107 , the two terms regarding @xmath106 in the right hand side of eq </S>",
    "<S> .   cancels . </S>",
    "<S> we then reach the formula   for the case with a single fs .    </S>",
    "<S> the proof can be generalized to the case with generic multiple fss which may be closed or open  [ fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ fig : gent](b ) ] , with multiple bands crossed by fermi energy , and with the pairing within each fs or between two different fss , given that the pairing fully gaps out the bulk  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> since the result is not restricted by pairing types , the generic theorem shown here is powerful to quantitatively determine the topology of the superfluid phases . </S>",
    "<S> on the other hand , it should be noted that this theorem is applied to judge the topology of the phase gapped out by small pairing orders . </S>",
    "<S> starting from the phase governed by eq .  </S>",
    "<S> , when the magnitude of superfluid order increases , the system may undergo further topological phase transition and enter a new phase with different topology . </S>",
    "<S> monitoring such phase transitions can determine the topological region of the phase diagram .    _ phase diagram._ with the above theorem we can easily determine the topology of the superfluid phase . </S>",
    "<S> note that for the present dirac system , a bcs pairing can not fully gap out the bulk but leads to nodal phases , while the fflo or ff order can . </S>",
    "<S> when there is only one fs , the system with an ff order is topological since @xmath108 and @xmath109 , giving the chern number @xmath110 . in contrast , when there are two fss , from the same or different bands , one can readily find that the contributions from both fss cancels out and the chern number is zero , rendering a trivial phase . </S>",
    "<S> this result implies that the system can be topological when it is in an ff phase .    from the mean field results shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ deltacal ] ( a , b ) , we can see that the bcs pairing is greatly suppressed , and @xmath111 dominates over @xmath112 , with @xmath113 for positive @xmath64 . a rich phase diagram is given in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ deltacal ] ( c , d ) , where the topological and trivial ff phases , and fflo phase are obtained . </S>",
    "<S> it is particularly interesting that in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ deltacal ] ( d ) a broad topological region is predicted when @xmath114 is away from @xmath115 . </S>",
    "<S> the broad topological region implies that the upper critical value @xmath116 , characterizing the transition from topological ff state to other phases , is largely enhanced compared with the case for @xmath115 . </S>",
    "<S> this is a novel effect explained below . </S>",
    "<S> note that the superfluid order @xmath111 also couples the particle - hole states at @xmath117 . </S>",
    "<S> increasing @xmath111 to @xmath118 closes the bulk gap at @xmath119 momentum , with the critical value being solved from bdg hamiltonian as @xmath120 where @xmath121 . for @xmath115 </S>",
    "<S> , we have @xmath122 and a small critical value @xmath123 . </S>",
    "<S> this is because the gap closes at the right hand dirac point @xmath124 , where the original bulk gap less than @xmath125 before having superfluid pairing [ fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ deltacal](e ) ] . </S>",
    "<S> importantly , for @xmath126 , we find that @xmath127 , which is of the order of band width . in this regime @xmath119 </S>",
    "<S> is away from the right hand dirac point , and corresponds to a relatively large bulk gap before adding @xmath111 [ fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ deltacal](f ) ] . as a result , </S>",
    "<S> a large @xmath111 is necessary to drive the phase transition , giving a broad topological region , as shown in fig .  </S>",
    "<S> [ deltacal ] ( d ) </S>",
    "<S> .     dominates over others for @xmath128 . </S>",
    "<S> ( c ) phase diagram with normal - size topological region when @xmath129 . </S>",
    "<S> ( d ) phase diagram with broad topological region . </S>",
    "<S> the values of the parameters in diagrams ( a , b , d ) are @xmath130 . </S>",
    "<S> schematic diagrams showing the underlying mechanism for the normal - size ( c ) and broad ( d ) topological regions . ]    </S>",
    "<S> _ conclusion._in conclusion , we have proposed an experimental scheme to realize chiral fulde - ferrell ( ff ) superfluids , and showed a generic theorem to determine the topology of tsf phases through the normal states . </S>",
    "<S> we start with a tunable dirac semimetal driven by 2d so coupling , which has not been discovered in condensed matter materials but can be readily realized with the current ultracold atom experiments , and show how a superfluid phase with nonzero center of mass momentum is typically favored in the system . </S>",
    "<S> moreover , we have shown a generic formalism for the chern number of a 2d superfluid induced in the normal states , with which the topological chiral ff superfluid with a broad topological region is predicted . </S>",
    "<S> our findings are of significance for both ultracold atoms and condensed matter physics , and also can be useful for material science in search for new topological superconducting states .    </S>",
    "<S> this work is supported by most ( grant no . </S>",
    "<S> 2016yfa0301604 ) , nsfc ( no . 11574008 ) , and thousand - young - talent program of china .    2    z. wu , l. zhang , w. sun , x .- </S>",

    "<S> the pairing can occur between two different fermi surfaces , say between @xmath75 and @xmath133 . in this case </S>",
    "<S> the eq .   </S>",
    "<S> is still valid , but the integral will be performed on both fermi surfaces at the same time , see  @xcite . </S>"
